sections.assessment: Assess Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS), pupillary response, and motor function. Look for signs of increased intracranial pressure.
sections.intervention: Maintain cerebral perfusion pressure. Consider hyperosmolar therapy for elevated ICP. Avoid hyperventilation.
sections.monitoring: Monitor GCS, pupillary response, and vital signs every 15-30 minutes.

Traumatic_Brain_Injury_PFC.full_text: Traumatic brain injury management requires careful neurological assessment...
